QUERY_CLOB:
select 
a110.pass_yn,
a110.application_id,
a110.page_id,
a110.page_name,
a110.redirect_url,
a110.button_name,  
a110.label, 
a110.region,
a110.created_by,
a110.created_on,
a110.last_updated_by, 
a110.last_updated_on,
case when a110.pass_yn = 'N'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Button, `%1`/`%2`, has an invalid link: `%0` (region : `%3`)^',
     p0 => a110.redirect_url,
     p1 => a110.button_name,  
     p2 => a110.label, 
     p3 => a110.region
     )
     end as validation_failure_message,
case when a110.pass_yn = 'N'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Button has an invalid link (page %0, app %1)^',
     p0 => a110.page_id,
     p1 => a110.application_id
     )
     end as issue_title,
a110.component_id,
a110.parent_component_id,
a110.workspace
from (
    select 
    eba_stds_parser.is_valid_url (p_origin_app_id => bl.application_id,
                                p_url           => bl.redirect_url
                                ) pass_yn,
    bl.application_id, 
    bl.redirect_url,
    bl.page_id,
    bl.page_name,
    bl.button_name,  
    bl.label, 
    bl.region,
    app.created_by,
    app.created_on,
    coalesce(bl.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
    coalesce(bl.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
	  bl.button_id component_id,
	  null parent_component_id,
	  bl.workspace
    from apex_application_page_buttons bl
    inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = bl.page_id
                                          and app.application_id = bl.application_id
    inner join v_apex_applications aa1 on bl.application_id = aa1.application_id
                                       and aa1.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	  left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = app.build_option
                                                         and aabo1.application_id = app.application_id
    left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = bl.build_option
                                                         and aabo2.application_id = bl.application_id
	  where bl.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
    and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
    and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
) a110
FIX: Fix the URL or eliminate the button

TEST_NAME: List entries should have valid build options
QUERY_CLOB:
select 
a80.pass_yn,
a80.application_id,
null page_id,
a80.child_code,
a80.created_on,
a80.created_by,
a80.last_updated_by, 
a80.last_updated_on,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) has an invalid build option: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) Excluded by build option for too long: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     end as validation_failure_message,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Invalid build option for list entry (%2) in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%2) Excluded by Build Option for too long - in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     end as issue_title,
a80.component_id,
a80.parent_component_id,
a80.workspace
from (
     select
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'N'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get_preference ('AST_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'N'
                    else 'Y'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then 'Y'
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'N'
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     ale.application_id,
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get_preference ('AST_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then null
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
          end child_code,
     ale.list_entry_id component_id,
     ale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
     ale.list_name,
     ale.entry_text,
     ale.entry_target,
     ale.build_option,
     aa.created_on,
     aa.created_by,
     ale.last_updated_by, 
     ale.last_updated_on,
     bo.build_option_status,
	   bo.status_on_export,
	   ale.workspace
     from apex_application_list_entries ale
     inner join v_apex_applications aa on  ale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
     left join apex_application_build_options bo on  ale.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                 and ale.build_option = bo.build_option_name
	   where ale.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
) a80
EXPLANATION:
\[List Build Entries are invalid\]

*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : List Entry Excluded by Build Option for too long
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : The build option on this list entry is in an invalid state
FIX:
*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : Remove the build or eliminate the page
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : Remove or replace the build option

QUERY_CLOB:
select case when eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.heading) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.column_link_text) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when aaprc.html_expression is not null 
            then eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.html_expression)
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aaprc.application_id, 
       aaprc.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aaprc.last_updated_by,
       aaprc.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML [html exporession :`%3`, heading:`%4`, column_link_text: `%5`', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id,
        p3 => aaprc.html_expression,
        p4 => aaprc.heading,
        p5 => aaprc.column_link_text) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id) issue_title,
       aaprc.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aaprc.heading,
       aaprc.column_is_hidden,
       aaprc.column_alias,
       aaprc.html_expression,
       aaprc.workspace,
       aaprc.column_link_text
from apex_application_page_rpt_cols aaprc
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aaprc.page_id and aap.application_id = aaprc.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aaprc.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aaprc.application_id
where aaprc.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
FIX: Fix the HTML - make sure all open tags are closed

TEST_NAME: Pages have name, title and not a blank space
QUERY_CLOB:
with aap as (select case
                 when (trim(page_name) is null or lower(trim(page_name)) = ' '
                           or trim(page_title) is null or lower(trim(page_title)) = ' ') 
                      then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id, 
						       page_id,
						       page_name,page_title, page_mode,
                   created_by,created_on,last_updated_by,last_updated_on, 
						       build_option,
						       workspace
              from apex_application_pages
             where page_function != 'Global Page'
)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name (`%0`) or title (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
        p3 => aap.page_title) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name or title', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
       aap.page_title,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
EXPLANATION:
WCAG 2.0/2.1 - 'Y'.3.1 Info and Relationships, 

 2.4.6 Headings and Labels

2.5.3 Label in Name

3.3.2 Labels or Instructions

4.1.2 Name, Role, Value

TEST_NAME: List Entries should use the correct icons
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when aale.entry_image like 'fa%'
                         then 'N'
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    aale.application_id, 
                    null page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    aale.last_updated_by,
                    aale.last_updated_on,
                    aale.list_entry_id component_id,
                    aale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
                    aale.entry_image,
                    aale.entry_text,
						        aale.workspace
               from apex_application_list_entries aale
               inner join apex_applications aa on aale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                             and aa.theme_number = 1000
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aale.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aale.application_id
               where aale.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
               and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude')
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       std.component_id,
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.entry_image,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses a Univeral Theme icon (`%2`). You must use a Redwood icon.',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id,
                    p2 => std.entry_image
                    )
            end  validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses an invalid icon',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id
                    )
            end  issue_title, 
       std.entry_text,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: List entries must not use a Universal theme icon in the `entry_image` field
FIX: Replace the icon with a Redwood icon

TEST_NAME: SVT Application Pages should have Authorization Schemes
QUERY_CLOB:
with origin_auth as (select 
                         spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                         , listagg(distinct spu.element_authorization       ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.element_authorization) origin_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.parent_element_authorization,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.parent_element_authorization) origin_parent_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.page_authorization          ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.page_authorization) origin_page_authorization
                         from v_mv_svt spu
                         where spu.destination_app_id is not null
                         and spu.destination_page_id is not null
                         and spu.url_type not in ('BC_URL') --breadcrumbs cause a lot of complexity in this context
                         group by spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                    ),
     a40 as (
          select 
          case when aap.page_requires_authentication = 'Yes'
               and aap.authorization_scheme is null
               then 'N'
			 				 when aap.authorization_scheme = 'APPLICATION SENTRY'
			 				 then 'N'
               else 'Y'
               end as pass_yn, 
          aap.application_id,
          aap.page_id, 
          aap.page_name, 
          aap.page_access_protection, 
          aap.page_mode,
          aap.page_requires_authentication,
          apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', oa.origin_element_authorization,oa.origin_parent_element_authorization, oa.origin_page_authorization, aa.authorization_scheme) origin_authorizations,
          aap.build_option,
          bo.build_option_status,
			    bo.status_on_export,
          oa.origin_element_authorization,
          oa.origin_parent_element_authorization origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
          oa.origin_page_authorization, 
          aa.authorization_scheme app_authorization_scheme,
          aap.created_by, 
          aap.created_on, 
          aap.last_updated_by, 
          aap.last_updated_on,
			    aap.workspace
          from apex_application_pages aap
          inner join apex_applications aa on aap.application_id = aa.application_id
                                          and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
          left join apex_application_build_options bo on aap.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                  and aap.build_option = bo.build_option_name
          left join origin_auth oa on oa.destination_app_id = aap.application_id
                                   and oa.destination_page_id = aap.page_id
          where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
			    and aap.page_id != 0
          and (bo.status_on_export != 'Exclude' or bo.build_option_status is null)
     )
select a40.pass_yn, 
       a40.application_id,
       a40.page_id, 
       a40.page_name, 
       a40.page_access_protection, 
       a40.page_mode,
       a40.page_requires_authentication,
       a40.origin_authorizations,
       a40.build_option,
       a40.build_option_status,
       a40.origin_element_authorization,
       a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
       a40.origin_page_authorization, 
       a40.app_authorization_scheme,
       a40.created_by, 
       a40.created_on, 
       a40.last_updated_by, 
       a40.last_updated_on,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %10 is missing an authorization scheme. 
            • Page Access Protection: %0
            • Page Mode: %1
            • Page Requires Authentication: %2
            • Origin Authorizations: %3 
            %4 
            %5^',
            p0 => a40.page_access_protection, 
            p1 => a40.page_mode,
            p2 => a40.page_requires_authentication,
            p3 => a40.origin_authorizations,
            p4 => case when a40.build_option is not null
                       then '• Build Option: '||a40.build_option
                       end,
            p5 => case when a40.build_option_status is not null
                       then '• Build status: '||a40.build_option_status
                       end,
            p6 => a40.origin_element_authorization,
            p7 => a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
            p8 => a40.origin_page_authorization, 
            p9 => a40.app_authorization_scheme,
            p10 => a40.page_id
            )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %0 (app %1) is missing an authorization scheme^',
            p0 => a40.page_id, 
            p1 => a40.application_id
            )
            end as issue_title,
			 a40.page_id component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 a40.workspace
from a40
where a40.application_id = 17000033
EXPLANATION: SVT Application pages should have authorization schemes for consistency and security
FIX:
Select an authorization scheme applied to the page. Authorization schemes are defined at the application-level and can be applied to many elements within the application.

An authorization scheme is evaluated either once for each application session (at session creation), or once for each page view. If the selected authorization scheme evaluates to **TRUE**, then the page displays and is subject to other defined conditions. If it evaluates to **FALSE**, then the page does not display and an error message displays.

TEST_NAME: Redwood Page Items should use Redwood Icons
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when ITEM_ICON_CSS_CLASSES like 'fa-%'
                         then 'N' 
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    aapi.application_id, 
                    aapi.page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    aapi.last_updated_by,
                    aapi.last_updated_on,
                    aapi.item_id component_id,
                    null parent_component_id,
                    aapi.item_icon_css_classes,
                    aapi.item_name,
						        aapi.workspace
               from apex_application_page_items aapi
               inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
               inner join apex_applications aa on aapi.application_id = aa.application_id
                                             and aa.theme_number = 1000
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
               where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
               and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
               and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude')
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) uses a `Universal Theme` icon: `%3`. You must replace with a `Redwood` icon.',
                    p0 => std.item_name,
                    p1 => std.page_id,
                    p2 => std.application_id,
                    p3 => std.item_icon_css_classes
                    )
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) has an invalid icon',
                    p0 => std.item_name,
                    p1 => std.page_id,
                    p2 => std.application_id
                    )
            end issue_title,
       std.component_id,
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.item_icon_css_classes,
       std.item_name,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: Redwood Page Items cannot use Universal Theme icons
FIX: Replace the icon with a Redwood Icon

TEST_NAME: Redwood Buttons should be correctly placed
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when apb.display_position in ('Region Body', 'Body')
                         then case when apr.template not in ('Blank with Attributes','Collapsible','Cards Container')
                                   then 'BUTTON_RW_POSITION'
                                   end
                         end child_code,
                    apb.application_id,
                    apb.page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    apb.last_updated_by,
                    apb.last_updated_on,
                    apb.display_position_code,
                    apb.button_is_hot,
                    apb.display_position,
                    apb.button_name,
                    apb.button_id component_id,
                    apb.button_template,
                    apb.button_position,
                    apr.template,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
                    abo.status_on_export,
						        apb.workspace
            from apex_application_page_buttons apb 
            inner join apex_application_page_regions apr on apb.application_id = apr.application_id
                                                         and apb.page_id = apr.page_id
                                                         and apb.region_id = apr.region_id
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on apb.application_id = aap.application_id
                                                  and apb.page_id = aap.page_id
            inner join apex_applications aa on apb.application_id = aa.application_id
                                            and aa.theme_number = 1000
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                               and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                               and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
						where apb.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is not null
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format ('Button `%0` (page %1, app %2) is in position `%3` but should be in a Redwood button position',
                            p0 => std.button_name,
                            p1 => std.page_id,
                            p2 => std.application_id,
                            p3 => std.display_position) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format ('Button `%0` (page %1, app %2) is incorrectly placed',
                            p0 => std.button_name,
                            p1 => std.page_id,
                            p2 => std.application_id) 
            end issue_title,
	     std.child_code,
       std.button_is_hot,
       std.display_position,
       std.button_name,
       std.component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
       std.button_template,
       std.button_position,
       std.template region_template,
       std.display_position_code,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: It is rarely correct to place Redwood buttons in the 'Region Body'/'Body' position.
FIX: Place the button in a Redwood, non-legacy position

QUERY_CLOB:
select a1.pass_yn, 
       a1.application_id,  
			 null child_code,
       a1.authorization_scheme,
			 null page_id,
       a1.created_by, 
       a1.created_on, 
       a1.last_updated_by, 
       a1.last_updated_on,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as issue_title,
			 null component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a1.workspace
from (
    select 
    case when aa.authorization_scheme is null
        then 'N'
        else 'Y'
        end as pass_yn,
    aa.application_id,
    aa.authorization_scheme,
    aa.created_by, 
    aa.created_on, 
    aa.last_updated_by, 
    aa.last_updated_on,
    apex_string.format( p_message => q'^Application %0 is missing an Authorization scheme^',
                        p0        => aa.application_id
    ) issue_desc,
	  aa.workspace
    from v_apex_applications aa
    where aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
) a1
EXPLANATION:
\[Applications have authorization schemes\]  
Applications should have application-level authorization schemes as a matter of best-practice
FIX: Specify an authorization scheme for your application. Application authorization schemes are defined for an application for the purpose of controlling access. Setting a required authorization scheme here at the application level will require all pages of the application to pass the defined authorization check.

QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select apb.application_id, 
                    apb.page_id, 
                    apb.button_id component_id, 
                    apb.button_name, 
                    bto.column_value template_option,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    apb.last_updated_by,
                    apb.last_updated_on,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
						 				abo.status_on_export,
						        abo.workspace
            from apex_application_page_buttons apb
            inner join table(apex_string.split(apb.button_template_options, ':')) bto 
                        on bto.column_value in ('rw-Button--sm', 'rw-Button--md', 'rw-Button--lg', 't-Button--tiny', 't-Button--small', 't-Button--large')
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                  and aap.page_id = apb.page_id
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on  abo.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                               and aap.build_option = abo.build_option_name
            where abo.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
						and coalesce(abo.status_on_export, 'NA') not in ('Exclude')
            )
select 'N'  pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size but currently has a size of `%3`', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.template_option) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id) issue_title,
       std.component_id,
       std.button_name,
       std.template_option,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: Button size should be default - always.
FIX: Restore the button size to default

TEST_NAME: HTML should be escaped in IG Columns
QUERY_CLOB:
select a20.pass_yn, 
       a20.application_id,
       a20.page_id,
       a20.region_id, 
       a20.region_name,
       a20.report_type,
       a20.column_alias,
       a20.report_label,
       a20.created_by, 
       a20.created_on, 
       a20.last_updated_by, 
       a20.last_updated_on,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` is escaping HTML for column `%3`/`%4` (Region id : %0, type : %2).^',
                                    p0 => a20.region_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.report_type,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` (app %0, page %2) is escaping HTML for column `%4`^',
                                    p0 => a20.application_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.page_id,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
       a20.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a20.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic2.escape_on_http_output ='Yes'
          then 'Y'
          when ic2.escape_on_http_output is null
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end as pass_yn, 
     ic2.application_id, 
     ic2.region_id, 
     ic2.page_id,
     ic2.region_name, 
     'IR' report_type,
     ic2.name column_alias,
     ic2.heading report_label,
     app.created_by, 
     app.created_on, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
     ic2.column_id component_id,
	   ic2.workspace
     from apex_appl_page_ig_columns ic2
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic2.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic2.application_id
     inner join v_apex_applications aa on ic2.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	   where ic2.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
) a20
EXPLANATION: IG Report columns should escape HTML : Avoid turning the "Escape special characters" setting off on report columns
FIX: To prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks, always set this attribute to **On**. If you need to render HTML tags stored in the page item or in the entries of a list of values, you can set this flag to **Off**. In such cases, you should take additional precautions to ensure any user input to such fields are properly escaped when entered and before saving.
